name.ingredients: 500g chicken (boneless, cut into bite-sized pieces),1/2 cup yogurt, 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste, 1 teaspoon red chili powder, 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder, 1 teaspoon garam masala,1 tablespoon lemon juice, 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, 1/4 cup cornstarch, 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder, 1/2 teaspoon black pepper powder, Oil for deep frying, Fresh curry leaves, Lemon wedges, Sliced onions, Salt to taste.
instructions: In a large bowl, combine yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, lemon juice, and salt. Add the chicken pieces and mix well to coat them evenly. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
In a separate bowl, mix all-purpose flour, cornstarch, red chili powder, black pepper powder, and salt.
Remove the marinated chicken from the refrigerator. Dredge each piece of chicken in the flour mixture, ensuring an even coating.
Heat oil in a deep-frying pan or wok over medium heat. Fry the coated chicken pieces in batches, making sure not to overcrowd the pan.
Fry until golden brown and crispy, about 4-5 minutes per batch.Remove the fried chicken with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels.
In a small pan, heat a little oil and fry fresh curry leaves until crisp. Garnish the fried chicken with the crispy curry leaves, lemon wedges, and sliced onions. Serve hot as a snack or appetizer.
